summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons internal memorandum from an Electronics Technician to an Operations Lieutenant, reporting the response to a medical emergency involving inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:35 a.m. It documents that Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell with CPR in progress and was transported to Health Services.

persons.name: Epstein, J
persons.context: The inmate who was the subject of the medical emergency, found unresponsive in his cell with CPR in progress.

persons.name: Correctional Lieutenant
persons.context: The officer who was performing CPR on inmate Epstein when the Electronics Technician arrived at the scene.

persons.name: Operations Lieutenant
persons.context: The recipient of this internal memorandum from the Electronics Technician.

persons.name: Electronics Technician
persons.context: The author of the memorandum who responded to the medical emergency on 9 South and reported the incident.

connections.description: The Electronics Technician responded to the medical emergency involving inmate Epstein.
The Correctional Lieutenant was performing CPR on inmate Epstein when the Electronics Technician arrived.
The Electronics Technician is reporting the incident to the Operations Lieutenant via this internal memorandum.

events.title: Medical Emergency Involving Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: At approximately 6:35 a.m., inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell on 9 South. CPR was in progress by a Correctional Lieutenant, and he was transported to Health Services.

keyFacts: The document is a Bureau of Prisons internal memorandum dated August 10, 2019, reporting a medical emergency involving inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
The incident occurred at approximately 6:35 a.m. on Saturday, August 10, 2019, on 9 South.
Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell with CPR already in progress by a Correctional Lieutenant.
Epstein was transported to the Health Services Area following the emergency response.
